data.title: Concept Systems Inc.
data.meta_description: Concept Systems Incorporated brings organizations working on any collaborative initiative a superior process of capturing group wisdom from different points of view.
data.text:
Mary Kane, M.S.

President and Principal Consultant

Ms. Kane is the President and Chief Executive Officer of Concept Systems, Incorporated (CSI). Having grown the company in visionary and practical ways since 1993, Mary has developed and led the CSI team in their service to hundreds of consulting clients and thousands of researchers all over the world who use the groupwisdom™ tools and methods. Mary’s expertise has helped agencies to develop strategic operational plans, products, and programs, envision and execute novel education and training approaches, and create program needs assessments and evaluations. She is also a sought-after organizational and leadership development consultant.

For almost 30 years, Ms. Kane has planned and conducted research and evaluation initiatives for federal, state, and county agencies, health and mental health organizations, private corporations, nonprofit agencies, and school districts. She has provided counsel to groups ranging from small boards of directors to organizations represented by thousands of stakeholders.

In collaboration with clients and research colleagues, Ms. Kane has co-authored numerous articles on the applications of Group Concept Mapping and pattern matching in organizational decision making and strategic planning. She is also the first author of the definitive volume on Concept Mapping: Concept Mapping for Planning and Evaluation (Kane & Trochim, 2007) and the important text on applications of GCM: Conversations About Group Concept Mapping (Kane & Rosas, 2017). Mary is also the author of the popular training course: Group Concept Mapping Design and Practice.

Ms. Kane co-founded CSI after a successful career in the management and growth of community-based cultural and learning organizations. Under her leadership, the company has invested in the redevelopment of its groupwisdom™ software and process technology and has expanded the scope of CSI methods and services to meet clients’ needs. Ms. Kane holds a master’s degree in Library and Information Sciences from Columbia University.

Megan Begert, M.P.A.

Managing Director

Megan Begert serves as the Managing Director at CSI, where she oversees the company’s strategic planning, business management, and operational processes. Her role is crucial in supporting the CSI consulting team and the groupwisdom™ product team, ensuring the company not only maintains but enhances its reputation for excellence. Megan leads the development and execution of the strategic plan, fosters client relationships, and collaborates with the marketing and sales teams to adopt innovative business development strategies.

With a Bachelor of Arts in Anthropology from Ithaca College and a master’s degree in public administration (MPA) from Binghamton University, Megan has a robust background in nonprofit management and leadership. Her professional path includes significant international experience, such as working with the USAID monitoring and evaluation team in Dhaka, Bangladesh, and managing North American operations for a global consulting firm. Additionally, Megan has contributed to higher education as a graduate student recruiter for Syracuse University and Binghamton University, where she implemented systems that promoted long-term growth and sustainability.

As Managing Director, Megan utilizes her extensive experience in both domestic and global contexts to lead CSI. She is committed to driving the company forward by motivating teams, spearheading policy implementation, and representing CSI to clients and partners worldwide.

Scott R. Rosas, Ph.D.

Director of Research and Evaluation

Dr.Rosas is the Director of Research and Evaluation at Concept Systems. He serves as the primary methodologist for CSI, leading the applied investigation of complex problems in social and biomedical sciences. He has published and presented on methods, techniques, and practices in evaluation and applied research.

Dr. Rosas is an expert in the design and use of the group concept mapping methodology. At CSI, he leads the formal study of the concept mapping methodology and its application. His emphasis is on measurement approaches developed from concept mapping, with attention to the assessment of the validity and reliability of data collection tools.

Since 2000, Dr. Rosas has been a member of American Evaluation Association (AEA) and previously served as a member of the AEA’s standing committee on ethics. He received his PhD in Human Development and Family Studies from the University of Delaware, with an emphasis on program evaluation.

Staci Nugent, M.S.

Director of Finance and Administration

Ms. Nugent’s role as Director of Finance and Administration includes financial, human resources, and contract management, as well as supporting vendor/contractor relationships and overseeing company compliance and administration.

After earning a B.S. in Biological Sciences at Cornell University, Ms. Nugent attended graduate school at Stanford University, completing a master’s degree in genetics. After working in the biotech industry in the Bay Area in the field of DNA microarrays, she completed a second master’s degree in Viticulture & Enology from the University of California at Davis. In the years that followed, she found success in two careers – genetics research and winemaking. She then transferred the skills honed in these careers – analytical skills, attention to detail, and strategic planning – to the fields of finance and business management.

Nancy Szary, B.S.

Program and Operations Associate

As Program and Operations Associate, Ms. Szary provides support for the management and operations of the company and its senior leadership and engages in various business development, marketing, and sales initiatives. She is responsible for management of the training program which recently transitioned to a web-based program. She also provides project management for company projects and client work.

Prior to joining CSI, Ms. Szary was the Development Associate for the Hangar Theatre, Ithaca’s professional theater. During this time, she was involved in donor relations, a major capital campaign, and managed company events. Her additional experience includes planning and implementation of conferences and events for Cornell University’s College of Human Ecology and database management for the NYS 4-H Foundation.

Ms. Szary attended Cornell University where she earned a Bachelor of Science in Applied Economics and Management and lettered in Women’s Ice Hockey.

Emma Recckio, B.A.

Client Services Consultant

Mrs. Recckio works closely with Senior Consultants on the planning, design, management, and completion of client consulting projects.

Throughout her career, Mrs. Recckio has focused on helping education professionals and not-for-profit agencies increase their impact through systems and capacity-building. Her most recent position prior to joining CSI was as the Director of Community Impact with the United Way of Tompkins County (UWTC). In her role she oversaw UWTC’S grants management system, all grant processes, K-12 student programming, as well as other community impact related programming.

Mrs. Recckiois a graduate of the University of Richmond where she earned a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science, minors in Education and Society as well as Healthcare and Society, and lettered in Women’s Swimming.

Andrew J. Karhan, MA, MPA

Senior Consultant

Specializations:

Andrew has nearly 25 years of experience in the field of vocational rehabilitation, employment services, mental health, developmental disabilities, and transition. He currently serves as the Project Director of the Center for Advancing Policy on Employment for Youth. He has administered employment services programs for individuals with disabilities in multiple states, as well as provided technical assistance on the implementation of best practices in employment, youth, and transition services across a myriad of states and organizations across the U.S.

Past Projects:

Andrew was responsible for: co-authoring and facilitating the vision of Employment First in New York State through the development and implementation of the New York Employment Services System (NYESS); the administration of State’s Administrative Employment Network under Social Security Administration’s Ticket to Work program; the oversight and implementation of New York State’s Promoting the Readiness of Minors in Supplemental Security Income (PROMISE) project; and, the development of a state-wide work incentives navigator system.
